articles.description: NASA estimates 100 million pieces of debris from the ISS, satellites and other spacecraft are hovering over the Earth. Former NASA astronaut Terry Virts says some of this debris can fall to Earth and explains why there’s no viable plan to remove it.

articles.author: Will Sullivan
articles.title: A Rare Nova Explosion Will Soon Bring a 'New Star' to the Night Sky—How to Catch a Glimpse - Smithsonian Magazine
articles.description: In an event that occurs only once every 80 years, a distant remnant of a star will grow much brighter, briefly becoming visible to Earth
articles.content:
